articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German police said on Saturday that they were still searching for an unknown assailant hours after he killed three people and wounded others in a stabbing attack at a festival in the western city of Solingen.
articles.title: German police search for assailant in festival stabbing that killed 3

articles.author: Ismail Shakil, Stephanie Kelly
articles.description: Independent presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. abanonded his campaign on Friday and endorsed Republican Donald Trump, ending a presidential bid that he began as a Democrat trading on one of the most famous names in American politics.
articles.title: RFK Jr ends US presidential campaign, endorses Trump

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: President Joe Biden spoke by phone to the leaders of Qatar and Egypt on Friday, pushing for an elusive Gaza ceasefire-for-hostages deal as negotiators met in Cairo to try to overcome remaining obstacles.
articles.title: Biden speaks to Egypt, Qatar leaders in Gaza ceasefire push

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three fires blazed on a Greek-flagged oil tanker in the Red Sea, the United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations said on Friday, one day after rescuers evacuated its crew in the wake of an assault by Yemeni Houthi militants.
articles.title: Fires observed on board Greek-flagged tanker in Red Sea, says maritime agency

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Shigeru Ishiba, a former defence minister, said on Saturday he would run in the ruling Liberal Democratic Party leadership election on Sept 27 that will pick a successor to Prime Minister Fumio Kishida.
articles.title: Ishiba announces bid to succeed Kishida as Japan's leader

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Knife-wielding prisoners identifying themselves as Islamic State militants staged a bloody attack on guards in a Russian penal colony on Friday and seized hostages, according to state media and news outlets with ties to the security services.
articles.title: Islamist prisoners slash guards, seize hostages in Russian jail

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least nine Palestinians, including two children and a woman, were killed at dawn on Saturday by Israeli shelling in and around Gaza's Khan Younis and in the Al-Nuseirat camp area, the official Palestinian news agency Wafa reported.
articles.title: Israeli shelling in Gaza kills 9 Palestinians, Wafa says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Nikki Haley, a former rival to Donald Trump for the U.S. Republican presidential nomination, said on Saturday that isolationism was not healthy and that the party should stand with the country's allies, especially in the face of China.
articles.title: Former Trump rival Haley, in Taiwan, says isolationism not healthy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea expressed serious concern and strongly condemned on Saturday a revised nuclear strategic plan approved by U.S. President Joe Biden this year.
articles.title: North Korea says it strongly condemns US nuclear strategic plan

articles.author: Allison Lampert, David Ljunggren
articles.description: The union representing workers at Canadian National Railway said on Friday they would strike next week, in a fresh threat to the economy after vowing to challenge a government decision to end an unprecedented rail stoppage.
articles.title: Canada rail shutdown: CN workers to strike Monday
